Set.Text: Each source of [ICON_RES_MARBLE] Marble and [ICON_RES_STONE] Stone worked by this City produce +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have at least one of these resources improved with a Quarry.
You discover a crudely-drawn map which outlines nearby terrain and and evidence of recent barbarian activity!
Study their maps of nearby territory and barbarians.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Research Agreements are disabled in NQ games.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Writings from different Eras.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Art from different Eras.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are all filled with Writings from different Eras.
To maximize your bonus, make sure the Great Work Slots are filled with 2 Great Works of Art and 2 Artifacts with all 4 being from different Eras.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Liberty[ENDCOLOR] is best for civilizations which desire rapid expansion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Liberty will provide 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in every city. Unlocks building the Pyramids.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies in the Liberty tree will grant a free Great Person of your choice near the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. All cities gain +90% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards National Wonders and +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards any building required for a National Wonder.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Republic[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in every City and +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in cities when constructing Buildings.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Meritocracy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for each City you own [ICON_CONNECTED] connected to the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital and -5% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in non-occupied Cities. Provides a 25% [ICON_GOLD] Gold bonus from city connections (road and/or harbor connections between a capital city and other cities).

Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Honor[ENDCOLOR] improves the effectiveness of one's army in a variety of ways.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Honor gives a +33% combat bonus VS Barbarians, and notifications will be provided when new Barbarian Encampments spawn in revealed territory. Gain [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for the empire for each enemy unit killed. Unlocks building the Temple of Artemis.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies in the Honor tree will grant [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for each enemy unit killed. A Great General appears outside the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. Great Generals are earned twice as fast, have +2 [ICON_MOVES] Movement, and can be purchased with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era.

Set.Text: All units gain +15% [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength when attacking cities.
Requires Honor. +10% [ICON_FOOD] Growth in all cities. +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building ranged units.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Warrior Code[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]4 units are maintenance free, and receive 2 Warriors immediately. Gain [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each enemy unit killed. +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Barracks.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Professional Army[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Build Barracks, Armories, and Military Academies in half the usual time. +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from each Barracks.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Military Caste[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Walls increase Local City [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by 2 and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture by 2. Castles increase Local City [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by 1 and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture by 2.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Military Tradition[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Gold cost of upgrading Military Units reduced by 33%. Courthouses provide +4 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +4 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and are built in half the usual time.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Discipline[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength for Land Units and military units gain 50% more Experience from combat.
+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Piety[ENDCOLOR] increases the [ICON_PEACE] Faith of empires.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Piety provides you with +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital and allows you to build Shrines and Temples in half the usual time. Unlocks building Stonehenge.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Piety tree causes a Great Prophet to appear and Holy Sites provide +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
All Missionaries born in this city can spread religion three times. Provides a free Mosque in the city in which it is built.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Organized Religion[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Shrines and Temples.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mandate of Heaven[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]20% discount on all purchases of religious units and buildings with [ICON_PEACE] Faith. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith in the Capital.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Religious Tolerance[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from each Temple and cities with a majority religion also get the Pantheon belief bonus of the second most popular religion.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Theocracy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from each Shrine and Temple.[NEWLINE]Holy Sites provide +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[NEWLINE]The Grand Temple boosts [ICON_GOLD] Gold output in its city by 50%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Reformation[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from each Temple.[NEWLINE]+25% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from the Grand Temple.[NEWLINE]If you founded a religion, gain a bonus Reformation belief.

Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Patronage[ENDCOLOR] enhances the benefits of City-State friendship.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Patronage will cause [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with City-States to degrade 25% slower than normal. Unlocks building the Forbidden Palace.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies in the Patronage tree will cause all [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allied[ENDCOLOR] City-States to occasionally gift you [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People. [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Friendly[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allied[ENDCOLOR] City-State gifts of [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and [ICON_PEACE] Faith are increased by 50%, and Militaristic City-States send two units per gift.

Set.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Philanthropy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLD] Gold gifts to City-States produce 25% more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence. Resting point for [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with all City-States is increased by 20.

Scholasticism is a style of teaching employed in medieval European universities from around 1000-1500 AD. The method emphasized critical reasoning and debate. The teacher would choose a book for study, and then he and the students would debate the meaning of the book, examine other books on the same topic, examine any criticism of the work, and so forth, by so doing gaining a fuller understanding of the topic than might be gained by rote memorization. The movement was largely fueled by the rediscovery of the works of Greek philosophers and subsequent attempts to integrate them with Christianity.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City State [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Friends[ENDCOLOR] bonus per turn (per [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Friend[ENDCOLOR]):[NEWLINE]2 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Classical Era[NEWLINE]3 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Medieval Era[NEWLINE]4 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Renaissance Era[NEWLINE]5 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Industrial Era[NEWLINE]6 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Modern Era[NEWLINE]7 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Atomic Era[NEWLINE]8 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Information Era[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City State [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allies[ENDCOLOR] bonus per turn (per [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ally[ENDCOLOR]):[NEWLINE]3 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Classical Era[NEWLINE]6 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Medieval Era[NEWLINE]10 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Renaissance Era[NEWLINE]15 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Industrial Era[NEWLINE]21 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Modern Era[NEWLINE]28 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Atomic Era[NEWLINE]36 [ICON_RESEARCH] in Information Era

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scholasticism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]All City-States which are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Friends[ENDCOLOR] or [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allies[ENDCOLOR] provide bonus [ICON_RESEARCH] Science per turn based on your current Era. The bonus from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allies[ENDCOLOR] is higher.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Merchant Confederacy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and +2 [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence per turn for trade routes with City-States.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Consulates[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Gain 2 additional Delegates in the World Congress, and 1 additional Delegate for each Era you advance past the Renaissance.

Row.Text: Grants you 2 additional Delegates in the World Congress.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This building appears for free when you choose the Consulates Social Policy in the Patronage tree.

Grants you 1 additional Delegate in the World Congress.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This building appears for free when you choose the Consulates Social Policy in the Patronage tree and you have advanced to the Industrial Era.

Grants you 1 additional Delegate in the World Congress.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This building appears for free when you choose the Consulates Social Policy in the Patronage tree and you have advanced to the Modern Era.

Grants you 1 additional Delegate in the World Congress.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This building appears for free when you choose the Consulates Social Policy in the Patronage tree and you have advanced to the Atomic Era.

Grants you 1 additional Delegate in the World Congress.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This building appears for free when you choose the Consulates Social Policy in the Patronage tree and you have advanced to the Information Era.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aesthetics[ENDCOLOR] improves the civilization's ability to generate [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Aesthetics allows you to earn Great Writers, Artists, and Musicians 25% faster. Unlocks building the Uffizi.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies doubles the theming bonus you receive from Museums and Wonders and grants you 1 free Social Policy. It also allows the purchase of Great Writers, Artists, or Musicians with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era.

Set.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultural Centers[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Amphitheaters, Opera Houses, Museums and Broadcast Towers provide +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and are built in half the usual time.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultural Exchange[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from every Trading Post, Moai, Brazilwood Camp, and Chateau. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from every Great Work and Great Person tile improvement.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Artistic Genius[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]A Great Artist and a Great Writer appear. Amphitheaters, Opera Houses, Museums, and Broadcast Towers provide +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.

Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fine Arts[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Provides a free Scriptorium, Gallery, and Conservatory in your first 4 cities. Amphitheaters, Opera Houses, Museums, and Broadcast Towers increase city [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output by 25%.
Civilizations that adopt Fine Arts will receive a Scriptorium in their first 4 cities, which provides 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture as well as a Writer Specialist Slot.
Civilizations that adopt Fine Arts will receive a Gallery in their first 4 cities, which provides 1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness as well as an Artist Specialist Slot.
Civilizations that adopt Fine Arts will receive a Conservatory in their first 4 cities, which provides 1 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism as well as a Musician Specialist Slot.
The Grand Monument is your reward when you complete the Aesthetics Social Policy Tree. It grants you 1 free Social Policy.
The Grand Monument is your reward when you complete the Aesthetics Social Policy Tree. It grants you 2 free Social Policies.

Set.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Commerce[ENDCOLOR] provides bonuses to empires focused on [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Commerce allows you to earn Great Merchants 50% faster. Unlocks building Big Ben.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Commerce tree will grant you 2 additional Trade Route slots and double [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Great Merchant Trade Missions. It also allows the purchase of Great Merchants with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantilism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Mint, Market, Bank, and Stock Exchange. +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from every Trading Post. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from every Customs House.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Entrepreneurship[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from the East India Trade Company. Maintenance paid on Buildings reduced by 50%.
Silk Road
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Silk Road[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from all your foreign land and sea trade routes. Maintenance paid on Roads and Railroads reduced by 50%.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercenary Army[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Allows the purchasing of Landsknechts, and purchasing items in Cities requires 25% less [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Protectionism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each Caravansary and Harbor. +5 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from the East India Trade Company.

Row.Text: The Grand Bazaar is your reward when you complete the Commerce Social Policy Tree. It grants you 2 additional Trade Route slots.

Set.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rationalism[ENDCOLOR] improves the ability to use and generate [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Rationalism allows you to earn Great Scientists 25% faster. Unlocks building the Porcelain Tower.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Rationalism tree will grant +10% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science while the empire is [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happy. It also allows the purchase of Great Scientists with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Sovereignty[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_RESEARCH] Libraries, Universities, Observatories, Public Schools, and Research Labs.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Free Thought[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Trading Post and +4 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Customs House.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scientific Revolution[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Grants a free Technology.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Humanism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+17% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Universities.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Shrines
+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith from Tundra tiles
20% faster [ICON_FOOD] Growth Rate (excess Food) and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from cities with population of 10+
+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in each city
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith from Fishing Boats
Barracks provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and gain [ICON_PEACE] Faith if you kill an enemy unit within 6 tiles of your city
Palace provides +1 each of [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_PEACE] Faith, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, and [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness
+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from cities with population of 4+
Cities gain +50% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength and Walls provide +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith
+20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of Ancient/Classical Wonders
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Plantations
+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +25% faster border growth in each city
+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from cities on rivers and Watermills provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production

Row.Text: +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for each Cocoa
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith for each Silk and Cotton
+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith for each Horse, Deer, Ivory, Fur, and Bison
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith for each Sugar and Spice
+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in cities with a [ICON_CONNECTED] City Connection

Set.Text: Bonus vs Tanks (200)
Bonus vs Tanks (200)

Horse Archers are fast ranged units, deadly on open terrain. They are slightly stronger in defense than the Chariot Archer and can move through rough terrain without the Chariot Archer's movement penalty. They also start with the Shock I promotion. As a mounted unit, the Horse Archer is vulnerable to Spearmen. Unlike the Chariot Archer, the Horse Archer does not require Horses.

Must have built a Market in all Cities. The cost goes up the more cities there are in the empire. Gain an additional trade route slot and +25% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the city in which it is built. Trade routes other players make to a city with an East India Company will generate an extra 4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for the city owner and the trade route owner gains an additional 2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold costs of acquiring new tiles reduced by 25% in every city. Provides a free University in the city in which it is built.
